targets.legendFormat: $nodename - System - Processes executing in kernel mode
$nodename - User - Normal processes executing in user mode
$nodename - Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
$nodename - Idle - Waiting for something to happen
$nodename - Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
$nodename - Irq - Servicing interrupts
$nodename - Softirq - Servicing softirqs
$nodename - Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
$nodename - Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system
$nodename - Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
$nodename - PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
$nodename - SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
$nodename - Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
$nodename - Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
$nodename - Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache
$nodename - Unused - Free memory unasigned
$nodename - Swap - Swap space used
$nodename - Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
$nodename - {{device}} - Receive
$nodename - {{device}} - Transmit
$nodename - {{mountpoint}}
$nodename - {{device}} - Reads completed
$nodename - {{device}} - Writes completed
$nodename - {{device}} - Successfully read bytes
$nodename - {{device}} - Successfully written bytes
$nodename - {{device}} - Time spent doing I/Os
$nodename - Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
$nodename - Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
$nodename - Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
$nodename - CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
$nodename - Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
$nodename - Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
$nodename - Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
$nodename - Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
$nodename - Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
$nodename - WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
$nodename - Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
$nodename - Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
$nodename - Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)
$nodename - SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
$nodename - SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
$nodename - VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free
$nodename - VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
$nodename - VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used
$nodename - Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers
$nodename - AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages
$nodename - AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files
$nodename - KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable
$nodename - HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
$nodename - HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
$nodename - HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
$nodename - HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
$nodename - Hugepagesize - Huge Page size
$nodename - DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
$nodename - DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
$nodename - DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size
$nodename - Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
$nodename - MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
$nodename - NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage
$nodename - Pagesin - Page in operations
$nodename - Pagesout - Page out operations
$nodename - Pswpin - Pages swapped in
$nodename - Pswpout - Pages swapped out
$nodename - Pgdeactivate - Pages moved from active to inactive
$nodename - Pgfree - Page free operations
$nodename - Pgactivate - Pages moved from inactive to active

$nodename - InCsumErrors - IP datagrams with checksum errors

$nodename - InAddrErrors - IP inaddrerrors
$nodename - InCsumErrors - Segments received with checksum errors
$nodename - InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)
$nodename - InSegs - Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections
$nodename - OutRsts - Segments sent containing the RST flag
$nodename - OutSegs - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets
$nodename - RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
$nodename - CurrEstab - TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
$nodename - MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
$nodename - RtoAlgorithm - Algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets
$nodename - RtoMax - Maximum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds
$nodename - RtoMin - Minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds
$nodename - ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
$nodename - AttemptFails - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT and SYN-RCVD
$nodename - EstabResets - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state
$nodename - PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
$nodename - TCPAbortOnClose - Connections aborted due to early user close
$nodename - TCPAbortOnData - Connections aborted due to unexpected data
$nodename - TCPAbortOnLinger - Connections aborted in lingered state after being closed
$nodename - TCPAbortOnMemory - Connections aborted before attached to a socket
$nodename - TCPAbortOnTimeout - Connections aborted due timeout
$nodename - TCPAbortFailed - Connections aborted without send RST due insuffient memory
$nodename - TCPTimeouts - Other TCP connections timeouts
$nodename - DelayedACKLocked - Delayed acks further delayed because of locked socket
$nodename - DelayedACKLost - Times quick ack mode was activated
$nodename - DelayedACKs - Delayed acks sent
$nodename - SyncookiesFailed - Invalid SYN cookies received
$nodename - SyncookiesRecv - SYN cookies received
$nodename - SyncookiesSent - SYN cookies sent
$nodename - SynChallenge - Challenge ACKs sent in response to SYN packets
$nodename - TCPChallengeACK - Challenge ACKs sent (RFC 5961 3.2)
$nodename - TCPLossFailures - Timeouts in loss state
$nodename - TCPLossProbeRecovery - TCP loss probe recoveries
$nodename - TCPLossProbes - Sent TCP loss probes
$nodename - TCPLossUndo - Congestion windows recovered without slow start after partial ack
$nodename - TCPLostRetransmit - Retransmits lost
$nodename - ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored
$nodename - LockDroppedIcmps - ICMP packets dropped because socket was locked
$nodename - TCPDeferAcceptDrop - Dropped ACK frames received by a socket in SYN_RECV state
$nodename - TCPBacklogDrop - Packets dropped bacause the socket's receive queue was full
$nodename - OutOfWindowIcmps - ICMP packets dropped because they were out-of-window
$nodename - TCPMinTTLDrop - TCP packets dropped under minTTL condition
$nodename - TCPForwardRetrans - Packets losts retransmitted with Forward RTO-Recovery
$nodename - TCPSlowStartRetrans - Packets losts retransmitted after a slow start
$nodename - TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits

$nodename - TCPPartialUndo - Congestion windows partially recovered using Hoe heuristic
$nodename - PruneCalled - Pkts pruned from recv queue because of soc buf overrun

$nodename - PAWSActive - Active connections rejected because of time stamp
$nodename - PAWSEstab - Pkts rejects in estab connections because of timestamp
$nodename - PAWSPassive - Passive connections rejected because of time stamp

$nodename - TCPSackShiftFallback - SACKs fallbacks
$nodename - TCPSackShifted - SACKs shifted

$nodename - TCPSackMerged - SACKs merged

$nodename - NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
$nodename - InDatagrams - Packets received
$nodename - OutDatagrams - Packets sent
$nodename - InCsumErrors - Datagrams with checksum errors
$nodename - InErrors - Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
$nodename - RcvbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to receive
$nodename - SndbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to transmit
$nodename - NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
$nodename - InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
$nodename - OutErrors - Messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers
$nodename - InDestUnreachs - Destination Unreachable messages received
$nodename - OutDestUnreachs - Destination Unreachable messages sent
$nodename - InType3 - Destination unreachable
$nodename - OutType3 - Destination unreachable
$nodename - InType11 - Time Exceeded
$nodename - InCsumErrors - Messages with ICMP checksum errors
$nodename - InTimeExcds - Time Exceeded messages received
$nodename - OutTimeExcds - Time Exceeded messages sent
$nodename - InParmProbs - Parameter Problem messages received
$nodename - OutParmProb - Parameter Problem messages sent
$nodename - InSrcQuenchs - Source Quench messages received
$nodename - OutSrcQuenchs - Source Quench messages sent
$nodename - InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
$nodename - InRedirects - Redirect messages received
$nodename - OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
$nodename - OutRedirects -  Redirect messages sent. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects
$nodename - InTimestampReps - Timestamp Reply messages received
$nodename - InTimestamps - Timestamp (request) messages received
$nodename - OutTimestampReps - Timestamp Reply messages sent
$nodename - OutTimestamps - Timestamp (request) messages sent
$nodename - InEchoReps - Echo Reply messages received
$nodename - InEchos - Echo (request) messages received
$nodename - OutEchoReps - Echo Reply messages sent
$nodename - OutEchos - Echo (request) messages sent
$nodename - InAddrMaskReps - Address Mask Reply messages received
$nodename - InAddrMasks - Address Mask Request messages received
$nodename - OutAddrMaskReps - Address Mask Reply messages sent
$nodename - OutAddrMasks - Address Mask Request messages sent
$nodename - {{collector}} - Scrape duration
$nodename - {{collector}} - Scrape success
